text: Describe an algorithm for subtracting rational numbers. How does this compare to your algorithm for subtracting whole numbers?

Did You Know?

The signs for addition “+” and subtraction “-“ are very familiar. But it took a long time to create these symbols. The Egyptian sign for addition resembled a pair of legs with the reverse sign indicating subtraction:

The 14th century Nicole Oresme’s manuscripts is the first known use of + for addition. The plus sign + maybe a simplification of the Latin “et”. The – was written over M to indicate minus. Eventually the M was dropped. In 1518 Robert Recorde introduced the equal sign and “+” and “-“ to Britain.

(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plus_and_minus_signs)
